required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Implementing HPV DNA Self-Collection to Increase Rates of Cervical Cancer Screening in Transgender Men
clinical_study.official_title: Implementing HPV DNA Self-Collection to Increase Rates of Cervical Cancer Screening in Transgender Men

brief_summary.textblock: Transgender men are individuals born genetically female that have a gender identity that is incongruent with their biological sex. For those who have begun or completed transition, they may present as males but still have a uterus and cervix. Thus far, no distinction has been made between routine cervical cancer screening guidelines in non-transgender women and those for transgender men, despite wide variations in sexual practices, including lifelong vaginal abstinence. The purpose of this study is to offer transgender men seen at clinic visits self-collected HPV testing to evaluate for improved cervical cancer screening rates, as well as a survey to further investigate sexual practices, rates of appropriate screening prior to being offered self-collection, and barriers to obtaining appropriate care.

primary_outcome.description: Evaluate whether implementation of HPV DNA self swabs will increase rates of cervical cancer screening among transgender men by percentage of trans men who obtain screening through the study

secondary_outcome.description: Determine which barriers contribute most to lack of cervical cancer screening among transgender men. Measured via survey.

secondary_outcome.measure: incidence of high risk sexual practices
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluate for the presence of high risk behaviors to determine whether transgender men in our population are at higher or lower risk for HPV-related cervical dysplasia. Measured via survey.
Evaluate percentage of transgender men that have been vaccinated for HPV. Measured via survey.

arm_group.description: Will perform HPV testing with self-collected specimen

intervention.description: will perform HPV testing with self-collected specimen

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age >21 for survey and age> 25 for HPV testing
- Transgender male or gender non-conforming identity
- Female sex at birth
- Consent to participate in the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- impaired decision making capacity
- Absence of cervix
- Non-English speaking

eligibility.gender_description: Must be transgender masculine identifying with uterus and cervix.
